summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 12180, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of North Thirty-ninth Street, from the north line of the Government Canal to Fremont Avenue; Dayton Avenue, from Kilbourne Street to North Forty-second Street; Phinney Avenue, from Ewing Street to North Thirty-ninth Street, and Third Avenue Northwest, from Kilbourne Street to Ross Place, all in the City of Seattle, by grading the same in accordance with Resolution No. 380 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
